TEAM.TITLE: Access Development Services
TEAM.DESC: An India-based NGO working in the areas of livelihood and microfinance development in six Indian states. Digital Green is currently working with ACCESS in Madhya Pradesh state.

TEAM.TITLE: ASA: Action for Social Advancement
TEAM.DESC: An India-based NGO working with 120,000 families across 1,000 villages in 15 districts of Madhya Pradesh and Bihar in the area of ensuring of improving livelihoods on a sustainable basis with linkages to the Government of India's Agriculture Technology Management Agency (ATMA) initiative. Digital Green is currently working ASA in Madhya Pradesh state.

TEAM.TITLE: BAIF Development Research Foundation
TEAM.DESC: An India-based NGO working in more than 47,000 villages in 12 states in India focused on the areas of livestock, watershed, and land resources development. Digital Green is currently working with BAIF in Karnataka state.

TEAM.TITLE: Bihar Rural livelihoods Promotion Society
TEAM.DESC: Bihar Rural Livelihoods Promotion Society (BRLPS) is an independent society set up by the Government of Bihar and supported by the World Bank. The BRLPS is implementing JEEVIKA - Bihar Rural Livelihoods Project with the objective of enhancing the social and economic empowerment of the rural poor in Bihar. Digital Green is currently working with BRLPS in Bihar state.

TEAM.TITLE: DPIP
TEAM.DESC: The District Poverty Initiatives Project (DPIP) is an ambitious project of the Government of Madhya Pradesh for the alleviation of poverty in the State. The State Government is committed to reforms in governance and improved access to social services for the poor and the vulnerable. Digital Green is working with DPIP in the Indian state of Madhya Pradesh.

TEAM.TITLE: ICRISAT
TEAM.DESC: The International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics (ICRISAT) is a non-profit, non-political organization, headquartered in Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh, India that conducts agricultural research for development in Asia and sub-Saharan Africa with a wide array of partners throughout the world. Digital Green is working with ICRISAT in 2 districts of Karnataka state in India.

TEAM.TITLE: International Development Enterprises
TEAM.DESC: iDE is an international nonprofit organization which creates income and livelihood opportunities poor rural households primarily by providing agricultural water access for small farmers in eleven countries in Africa, Asia, and Latin America. Digital Green is currently working with iDE on promoting low-cost irritation technologies and agronomic practices in 7 districts of the Oromia region in Ethiopia.

TEAM.TITLE: Oxfam America
TEAM.DESC: Oxfam America (OA) is the global organization of the international Oxfam confederation and works in 90 countries working to create lasting solutions to poverty, hunger, and social injustice. Digital Green is currently working with OA as part of a partnership with Sasakawa Africa Association, in collaboration with the Ethiopian Ministry of Agriculture in 3 districts in Ethiopia.

TEAM.TITLE: Program for Appropriate Technology in Health
TEAM.DESC: PATH is an international nonprofit organization that transforms global health by developing and delivering high-impact, low-cost health solutions such as lifesaving vaccines and collaborative programs with communities in more than 70 countries. Digital Green is currently working with PATH on promoting reproductive and child health behaviors in Uttar Pradesh, India.

TEAM.TITLE: Pragati, Koraput
TEAM.DESC: Pragati, Koraput is a India-based NGO working in the areas of soil and water conservation, promotion of sustainable agriculture through organic practices, and introduction of new crop production technologies for food and income security of small and marginal farmers. Digital Green is currently working with Pragati, Koraput in Orissa state.

TEAM.TITLE: Professional Assistance for Development Action
TEAM.DESC: An India-based NGO that works across 7 of India's poorest states and that promotes self-help groups (SHGs), develops locally suitable economic activities, mobilizes finances, and introduces systems to improve livelihoods of the rural poor. Digital Green is currently working with PRADAN in Madhya Pradesh, Jharkhand, and Orissa states.

TEAM.TITLE: Samaj Pragati Sahayog
TEAM.DESC: An India-based NGO that works through its partners in 72 of India's most backward districts to ensure water and livelihood security for the tribal communities living there. Digital Green is currently working with SPS in the Dewas District of Madhya Pradesh state.

TEAM.TITLE: Sasakawa Africa Association
TEAM.DESC: Sasakawa Africa Association (SAA) is an international agricultural development organization with agricultural programs in 14 sub-Saharan countries to improve the productivity and profitability of smallholder farmers by encouraging the adoption of higher-yielding varieties and enhanced production practices. Digital Green is currently working with SAA as part of a partnership with Oxfam America, in collaboration with the Ethiopian Ministry of Agriculture in 3 districts in Ethiopia.

TEAM.TITLE: Society for Elimination of Rural Poverty
TEAM.DESC: Society for Elimination of Rural Poverty (SERP) is an autonomous society of the Department of Rural Development, Government of Andhra Pradesh. Digital Green is currently working with SERP in the Andhra Pradesh Pradesh state.

TEAM.TITLE: SPRING
TEAM.DESC: SPRING is a United States Agency for International Development (USAID)-funded five-year project. SPRING's focus is the reduction of anemia and stunting among women and young children through the expansion of effective social and behavior change communication (SBCC) and nutrition-sensitive programs at scale. Digital Green is working with SPRING in the Indian state of Odisha.

TEAM.TITLE: VARRAT
TEAM.DESC: VARRAT is a India-based NGO working in the area of livelihood and rural development to empower village communities to enable their self-sufficiency and self-sustainability. Digital Green is currently working with VARRAT in northern Orissa state.

TEAM.TITLE: Vodafone Foundation India
TEAM.DESC: Vodafone Foundation in India is combining skills, resources and funding to build a brighter future for people who are currently unable to fulfill their potential. The Foundation seeks to: empower women so that they can compete on an equal footing, to reach rural areas and support the people living there, and to provide new opportunities for education. Digital Green is working with the Vodafone Foundation in Karnataka state in India.

TEAM.TITLE: World Cocoa Foundation
TEAM.DESC: The World Cocoa Foundation (WCF) is an international organization committed to ensuring cocoa sustainability through agricultural and environmental stewardship, and development. Digital Green currently works with WCF in 2 districts of the Ashanti region in Ghana to promote agricultural elated messaging to cocoa farmers.
